intro: Anthemis abrotanifolia f. abrotanifolia, commonly known as common ragwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers in clustered inflorescences, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with a rough texture and a strong, often bitter scent. It is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in meadows.
